title: Library
content:
I realize this is probably an old sign but anyone have any recommendations for something simliar?

Thank you so much in advance! Seriously, huge help on this.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20091113121730im_/http:/typophile.com/files/tumblr_ks8pwhs1YD1qzzmh0o1_500_3688.jpg)
author: jonaschafer

comments.content:
Leslie Cabarga has made a number of successful ’chrome strip’ typefaces, notably Magneto and Raceway. This seems almost like a blend of them, but I thought [Raceway](http://web.archive.org/web/20091113121730/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/raceway/) was closer. Nick Curtis’s Lakeshore Drive is also this style, but not slanted. There are a number of others in this genre shown in Part 7 of my Script Font ID Guide, but I didn’t see an exact match. Maybe someone else recognizes it?

- Mike Yanega
Yep, really great sign. [Here’s my list of chrome script fonts.](http://web.archive.org/web/20091113121730/http:/www.fontshop.com/fontlist/genres/connected_chrome/)
I find it hard to believe there was a sign company that put that much care into a sign. Lovely. Is it an old sign? It actually looks fairly new.
Thanks guys! I’m not sure its origin, it was an image on FFFFound.
